snippet: A large number of lawmakers facing charges of wrongdoing were defeated on Tuesday, despite the fact that most incumbents seeking re-election to Congress typically return for another term.
abstract: Large number of Congressional lawmakers facing charges of wrongdoing are defeated in races around the country, despite the fact that more than 90 percent of incumbents seeking re-election to Congress typically return for another term.
lead_paragraph: A large number of lawmakers facing charges of wrongdoing were defeated on Tuesday, despite the fact that most incumbents seeking re-election to Congress typically return for another term.

headline.seo: Voters Oust Lawmakers Accused of Ethics Violations
headline.main: Ethics in Play, Voters Oust Incumbents Under Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Ethics in Play, Voters Oust Incumbents Under Inquiry
